Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the role of the "pay-as-you-go" law in achieving record surpluses in the 1990s.
Falters at times: The claim may falter in fully acknowledging other factors, such as the increase in tax receipts from the booming economy and defense cuts, that played a significant role in achieving a balanced budget.
Lack enough support: The claim may lack sufficient supporting evidence to conclusively prove the direct impact of the "pay-as-you-go" law on the record surpluses in the 1990s.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim may not fully consider alternative explanations or factors that contributed to the record surpluses, such as the end of the Cold War enabling defense cuts.
